1:
Yahweh, I have come to you to be safe;\q2 never allow me to become ashamed.
\q1
2:
Because you always do what is right, help me and rescue me;\q2 listen to me, and save me!
\q1
3:
Be like a huge rock on top of which I can be safe;\q1 be like a strong fortress in which I am safe.
\q1 You have commanded your angels to rescue me.


\q1
4:
God, rescue me from wicked people,\q2 from the power of unjust and evil men.
\q1
5:
Yahweh, my Lord, you are the one whom I confidently expect to help me;\q2 I have trusted in you ever since I was young.


\q1
6:
I have depended on you all my life;\q2 you have taken care of me since the day that I was born,
\q1 so I will always praise you.
\q1
7:
The manner in which you have rescued me has been an example to many people\q2 because they realize that you have been my strong defender.


\q1
8:
I praise you all during the day,\q2 and I proclaim that you are glorious.
\q1
9:
Now when I have become an old man, do not reject me;\q2 do not abandon me now when I am not strong anymore.


\q1
10:
My enemies say that they want to kill me;\q2 they talk together and plan how they can do that.
\q1
11:
They say, "God has abandoned him;\q2 so now we can pursue him and seize him
\q2 because there is no one who will rescue him."


\q1
12:
God, do not stay far away from me;\q2 hurry to help me!
\q1
13:
Cause those who accuse me to be defeated and destroyed;\q2 cause those who want to harm me to be shamed and disgraced.



\q1
14:
But as for me, I will continually and confidently expect you to do great things for me,\q2 and I will praise you more and more.
\q1
15:
I will tell people that you do what is right;\q1 all during the day I will tell people how you have saved me,
\q2 although what you have done is more than I can fully understand.
\q1
16:
Yahweh, my Lord, I will praise you for your mighty deeds;\q2 I will proclaim that only you always act justly.


\q1
17:
God, you have taught me many things ever since I was young,\q2 and I still tell people about your wonderful deeds.
\q1
18:
Now, God, when I am old and my hair is gray,\q2 do not abandon me.
\q1 Stay with me while I continue to proclaim to my children and grandchildren.



\q1
19:
God, you do many righteous deeds;\q2 it is as though they extend up to the sky.
\q1 You have done great things;
\q2 there is no one like you.
\q1
21:
You will cause me to be greatly honored,\q2 and you will encourage me again.
\q1
22:
I will also praise you while I play my harp;\q1 I will praise you, my God, for faithfully doing what you have promised to do.
\q1 I will play hymns to praise you, the holy God whom we Israelites worship.


\q1
23:
I will shout joyfully while I sing;\q1 with my entire inner being I will sing
\q2 because you have rescued me.
\q1
24: All during the day I will tell people that you act righteously\q2 because those who wanted to harm me will have been defeated and disgraced.
